question: If <katex>$y=a\sin x+b\cos x$</katex>, then <katex>$y^{2}+(\frac{dy}{dx})^{2}$</katex> is a
explanation: <katex>$y^2 + (\frac{dy}{dx})^2 = (a\sin x + b\cos x)^2 + (a\cos x - b\sin x)^2$</katex>
<katex>$= (a^2\sin^2 x + b^2\cos^2 x + 2ab\sin x\cos x) + (a^2\cos^2 x + b^2\sin^2 x - 2ab\sin x\cos x)$</katex>
<katex>$= a^2(\sin^2 x + \cos^2 x) + b^2(\cos^2 x + \sin^2 x)$</katex>
<katex>$= a^2 + b^2$</katex>, which is a constant.
